questions.question: He himself said this.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.

questions.question: She admired herself in the mirror.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: The Prime Minister himself received the visiting dignitaries.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.

questions.question: When I realized what I had done, I wanted to slap myself.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: She did all the work herself.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.

questions.question: Mother herself took me to hospital.
The player injured himself while playing football.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: I enjoyed myself during the holidays.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: They themselves caused all the trouble.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.

questions.question: They congratulated themselves on the victory.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and object refer to the same person or thing.

questions.question: The officer himself inspected the fields.
questions.description: We use emphatic pronouns for emphasis.
